title.narrative: 003 PUBLIC FINANCE FOR CHILDREN/PF4C

description.narrative: Institutional capacities for public finance management for children strengthened, which contributes to Child Poverty / Public Finance For Children, Children In Urban Settings / Local Governance, Cross-Sectoral Monitoring, Data And Situation Analyses, Operations Support To Programme Delivery, Public Finance And Local Governance, Social Protection. UNICEF aims to achieve this through Developing And Leveraging Resources And Partnerships, Operational Support To Programme Delivery, Systems Strengthening And Institution Building. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: By 2020, Ethiopian children benefit from an improved policy environment, and evidence-informed, child-friendly, gender-sensitive and results-oriented planning and financing in support of the inclusive, sustainable and equitable realization of child rights

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: Institutional capacities for public finance management for children strengthened

description.narrative: During the 2016-2020 country programme UNICEF's presence and influence in public finance has been established with government and development partners. Effective partnerships with government and development partners have also been established. UNICEF Ethiopia continues to strengthen public finance monitoring, analysis and policy advocacy to better inform programme, policy and public budget decisions for the realization of children's rights. | Status:Met | As-of Date:24/08/2020

title.narrative: Extent to which policy and budget frameworks address child poverty and disparities (score)(43921)
